line_1: Those who would gain the votes of British tribes,
line_2: Must add to force of merit, force of bribes.

line_1: Hast thou not heard, that 'mongst our antient Tribes
line_2: By Party warpt, or lull'd asleep by Bribes,

line_1: And apples of ten thousand tribes,
line_2: The nectarine his strong tint imbibes,

line_1: He gain'd the leaders of his neighbour tribes,
line_2: Sunk not his stores. With smiles and powerful bribes

line_1: In vain Corruption calls her venal tribes;
line_2: One common cause, one common end prescribes;

line_1: And parts with bars the undulating tribes.
line_2: Marks the gay trill, the solemn pause inscribes,

line_1: Stay in your crystal chambers, silver tribes!
line_2: Turn your bright eyes, and shun the dangerous bribes;

line_1: Or how fierce War destroys the wand'ring Tribes.
line_2: Their changing Forms no artful Verse describes,

line_1: To him, And to the Congregated Tribes
line_2: Declar'd his goodness who oe'r Earth presides.
